block.p: According to Bleecker, his father, a Jewish man, went to great lengths to make sure his son participated in black cultural activities and community. But what Jewish activities did his father make available? Is it necessary for Jewish identity to be minimized in order to assert African-American identity?
What does it mean when Jews like Marcus's father eloquently assert the rights of other groups but are mute when it comes to asserting or even articulating their own ethnicity?
